jProtocol.tls12.model.states

Class TlsStateMachine

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • jProtocol.Abstract.Model.StateMachine<TlsCiphertext>
        • jProtocol.tls12.model.states.TlsStateMachine
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    TlsClientStateMachine, TlsServerStateMachine

    public abstract class TlsStateMachine
extends StateMachine<TlsCiphertext>

    • Constructor Detail

      • TlsStateMachine

        public TlsStateMachine(TlsCipherSuiteRegistry cipherSuiteRegistry)
        Creates a state machine object. Registers states. Initial states must be set in subclasses.
        Parameters:
        cipherSuiteRegistry - a cipher suite registry

    • Method Detail

      • setTlsState

        public void setTlsState(TlsStateType stateType,
                        TlsState sender)
        Sets the state current state of this state machine.
        Parameters:
        stateType - the new state type
        sender - the calling state of this method

      • getCurrentTlsState

        public TlsStateType getCurrentTlsState()
        Returns the current state.
        Returns:
        the current state

      • currentReadCipherSuiteIsNotTlsNull

        public boolean currentReadCipherSuiteIsNotTlsNull()
        Returns whether the current read cipher suite is TLS_NULL_WITH_NULL_NULL.
        Returns:
        true, when it is NOT, false otherwise

      • currentWriteCipherSuiteIsNotTlsNull

        public boolean currentWriteCipherSuiteIsNotTlsNull()
        Returns whether the current write cipher suite is TLS_NULL_WITH_NULL_NULL.
        Returns:
        true, when it is NOT, false otherwise

      • getVersion

        public TlsVersion getVersion()
        Returns the currently set TLS version.
        Returns:
        the TLS version

      • setVersion

        public void setVersion(TlsVersion version)
        Sets the current TLS version.
        Parameters:
        version - the TLS version

      • isSupportedVersion

        public boolean isSupportedVersion(TlsVersion version)
        Returns whether the TLS version is supported. Currently just TLS 1.2 is supported.
        Parameters:
        version - the TLS version
        Returns:
        true, if the version is supported

      • getHighestSupportedVersion

        public TlsVersion getHighestSupportedVersion()
        Returns the highest supported TLS version (currently TLS 1.2).
        Returns:
        the highest supported version

      • canPerformAbbreviatedHandshakeForSessionId

        public boolean canPerformAbbreviatedHandshakeForSessionId(TlsSessionId sessionId)
        Returns whether an abbreviated handshake can be performed for the session ID.
        Parameters:
        sessionId - the session ID
        Returns:
        true, if an abbreviated handshake can be performed for the session ID

      • needsServerKeyExchangeMessage

        public boolean needsServerKeyExchangeMessage()
        Returns whether the negotiated cipher suite key exchange algorithm needs a server key exchange message.
        Returns:
        true, if a server key exchange message is necessary

      • setSessionId

        public void setSessionId(TlsSessionId sessionId)
        Sets the TLS session ID.
        Parameters:
        sessionId - the session ID

      • getSessionId

        public TlsSessionId getSessionId()
        Returns the currently set session ID.
        Returns:
        the session ID

      • increaseWriteSequenceNumber

        public void increaseWriteSequenceNumber()
        Increases the sequence number of the current write state. Should be called after sending a message.

      • increaseReadSequenceNumber

        public void increaseReadSequenceNumber()
        Increases the sequence number of the current read state. Should be called after receiving a message.

      • setClientRandom

        Sets the client random value.
        Parameters:
        random - the client random value

      • setPendingCipherSuiteFromList

        Sets the cipher suite in the pending state by choosing the first (preferred) cipher suite from a list.
        Parameters:
        list - the cipher suite list

      • changeReadStateToPendingState

        public void changeReadStateToPendingState()
        Sets the pending state as current read state. Should be called after receiving the change cipher spec message.

      • changeWriteStateToPendingState

        public void changeWriteStateToPendingState()
        Sets the pending state as current write state. Should be called after sending the change cipher spec message.

      • addHandshakeMessageForVerifyData

        public void addHandshakeMessageForVerifyData(TlsHandshakeMessage message)
        Adds a handshake message for inclusion in the verify data computation. Finished and hello_request messages must not be included.
        Parameters:
        message - the handshake message

      • isCorrectVerifyData

        public abstract boolean isCorrectVerifyData(TlsVerifyData verifyData)
        Returns whether the verify data received in the finished message is correct. This means the same handshake messages were converted with the same master secret and label.
        Parameters:
        verifyData - the verify data
        Returns:
        true, if the verify data computed locally is equal to the verify data included in the finished message

      • getVerifyDataToSend

        public abstract TlsVerifyData getVerifyDataToSend()
        Returns the verify data to include in the finished message
        Returns:
        the verify data

      • getCachedApplicationDataMessages

        public java.util.List<TlsApplicationDataMessage> getCachedApplicationDataMessages()
        Returns all cached application data messages.
        Returns:
        the cached application data messages

      • addCachedApplicationDataMessage

        public void addCachedApplicationDataMessage(TlsApplicationDataMessage message)
        Adds an application data message to the cached messages. This is used for application data messages which can be sent after the finished message before the communication partner is in established state.
        Parameters:
        message - the message

      • clearCachedApplicationDataMessage

        public void clearCachedApplicationDataMessage()
        Clears the application data message cache.

      • openConnection

        public void openConnection()
        Starts a connection to the server. Must be called in initial client state.

      • closeConnection

        public void closeConnection()
        Closes a connection. Must be called in established state.

      • resetConnection

        public void resetConnection()
        Resets the connection.

      • sendData

        public void sendData(TlsApplicationData data)
        Sends application data via an established connection.
        Parameters:
        data - the application data

      • receivedData

        public void receivedData(TlsApplicationData data)
        Receives TLS data.
        Parameters:
        data - the data

      • getViewData

        public java.util.List<KeyValueObject> getViewData()
        Returns the view data (list of key value objects) for displaying purposes.
        Returns:
        the view data
